intro: Hieracium bernense grex filicaule, commonly known as the Filicaule hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and basal rosettes of lanceolate leaves. Its flowers are yellow and arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, blooming from June to August. It thrives in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges.
